text: the new design manager is a nightmare :disappointed:
Whats a matter/
so far, my only major issue with it is the removal of the HubL/HTML modules and then also the removal of the "view source" in the rich text module.
but i totally understand using a custom module in place of the HubL/HTML module
:point_up: same here
THATS exactly my issue!
I think there really should be channels for each of the new beta/releases where we can provide feedback to those items in particular
then HS could have the Project Managers for those items in the channel to see the feedback
yes but now we need to “built” a custom module with the “html edit view” in there
basically they replaced the html / hubl so now there is no difference. It is more akin to how a standard site is built.
True, if its something simple like outputting todays date in the footer or a simple pull from company info then you have to create a whole module for nothing
Sorta like creating an include

We have a lot of the product team here, but honestly the best way to provide feedback is via the in-app modal (which I believe is on the lower-left) because that will go directly to the engineering team working on that specific feature/product.
coded templates makes development life much easier
:trollface: Nobody asked you <@U7V9DQ31P> :slightly_smiling_face:
you can keep using your float based bootstrap 2 grid if you want <@U38EZFVFE> :troll:

<@U2H3TT8F2> <@U6Z3FRJ2D> <@U38EZFVFE> Hi guys! Happy to report that we'll be adding the Edit Source Code function back into rich text modules over the next few weeks! We should have some more concrete updates that I can post in here before the end of the week :slightly_smiling_face:
yeah, but meanwhile, how can i insert a custom html to a page… :S
jajaja… yes… no, i think thats awesome, but some things are just broken and with no comunication on how it works now :s
You can always revert back to the old editor using the arrow in the bottom right. You can even add the module then switch back to the beta and it'll be there
and that on my “partner agency” side… but on the “client” side is worst.
but the problem is on the website side, no design side. In the website side on the “flexible columns” the module is just disapear
Hey all, two small updates I wanted to send your way, one as a heads up, one looking for feedback

On the forms side, we've just released a fix for a long standing bug with thank you messages. Up until now, if you put a personalisation token in the thank you message of the form, there's a chance that it might not work for brand new contacts (there was a race condition between creating the contact and rendering the page). We've updated it now to use the fields submitted on the form in addition to the information on the contact record so even if the submission is a brand new contact, the personalisation tokens will work in these cases.

On the lead flows side, we have a new feature allowing you to directly embed a lead flow callout into the content of a web page, and when clicked it triggers the form step of the lead flow to load on the page.

Spinning up an example page that you can take a look at now, two mins. But if you'd like to try this feature out and give us feedback on the implementation we'd love for you to be the first to check it out
That's cool! How does it work? Does it have an ID that we can anchor link to?

This version works by adding in a div (right now, we'll likely change to a link) on the page, like `<div data-HubSpot-embedded-flow="253862"></div>` and the lead flows JS kicks in a renders the callout in that place on the page.

We're building on top of that tech by adding in a callback function, or `data-` attribute you can add to any element on the page to use to trigger a lead flow when the user interacts on anything you like
So you could have a link, or an image, or a button and it could trigger a lead flow to load up and render on the page.
You can see it in action in this code pen: <https://codepen.io/anon/pen/VyOVKE>
If you'd like to try it out, you can DM me over your Hub ID and I can add you to the beta. If not, any and all feedback on the implementation described above is still appreciated :simple_smile:
This is awesome <@U24DCSJBE> So many possibilities
